p: Agantuja Vyadhi (~ diseases of exogenous origin) occurs due to physical/external factors like Bhuta, Visha, Vayu, Agni, and Prahara (trauma), etc. without any involvement of Vataadi Dosha initially; however, in later stage dosha are involved in the disease process [ 21, C.S.Soo11/45]. Cakrapaṇidatta clarifies that Bhuta means Visakṛimi or a virulent organism [ 21, C.S.Sa.1/121]; Krimi may be Sahaja (natural) or Vaikarika (pathogenic) organisms that may be visible (macroscopic) or invisible to the naked eye (microscopic) [ 21, C.S.Vi. 7/9,11].
